posts.title: FRILL SEEKERS
posts.content:
FRILL SEEKERS

Ruffles and frills — whether as an artful hemline or an all-over adornment— are this season’s go-to detail for effortless feminine flair. Adding a touch of flamboyance to classic designs with flounces, frills and ruffles, it’s the ideal way to refresh even the simplest of styles. Not sure? We show you how.

Strengthen Your Core

It’s no secret that every wardrobe relies on its basics – but that doesn’t mean they have to be boring. Give a plain white tee a fanciful makeover with asymmetric frill detail for instant impact. Wear with denim for bold off-duty appeal.

  • Cotton Poplin Ruffle Tee shop now
  • Powerhold Skinny Jean shop now
  • Tie Up Flat Mule shop now
  • Leather Paneled Rucksack shop now

Trouser Takeover

A new take on the 9-5 trouser, bold ruffle detail takes this classic pair to the next level. Pare back with a simple white shirt and let your trousers do the talking.

  • Silk Blouse shop now
  • Frill Hem Trousers shop now
  • Frill Hem Trousers shop now
  • Backless Slip On Shoe shop now

Grey Area

Quite simply, this frill tee is our new summer essential. Work around the clock, switching flats for heels – this tee requires little more than tailored culottes or a denim mini to make a statement.

  • Asymmetric Hem Top shop now
  • Soft Culotte shop now
  • Backless Slip On Shoe shop now
  • Marbled Round Sunglasses shop now

posts.title: New This Week
posts.content:
NEWS

What’s hot and happening this week – June 3rd – June 9th

 

TRENDING NOW: POWDER BLUE

Trading traditional all-weather navy for something a little lighter and brighter, a new blue hue is making its mark for SS16 – the powder variety. In January this year, Pantone’s official colour of the season – 15-3919 Serenity – dictated that this weightless and airy shade was the one to know thanks to its “calming effect” that offers a “respite in turbulent times.” A big ask of such a gentle shade, work this pastel tint across shirt dresses, tees and outerwear.

BREAKFAST OF CHAMPIONS

For the first time in its almost 100-year history, the world famous Ivy is now serving breakfast in its iconic luxurious surroundings. The early morning menu, as crafted by the executive chef Gary Lee, is a catalogue of classic favourites with a hint modern innovation. Upgrade your go-t childhood choice with their delicious soft boiled eggs with asparagus soldiers, or indulge in a next level cheese on toast courtesy of the Welsh Rarebit sourdough. Health-conscious diners don’t despair – you will love the Super Seed Bowls packed with chia, flax and oats.
Served from 8am at The Ivy, London, WC2H9NQ

HAVE A £1000 WARDROBE ON US!

No, you’re not reading it wrong – the chance to redo your summer style is well within reach. We’ve teamed up with the lovely lot at Refinery29 to offer one lucky person the chance to win a £1000 Warehouse Gift Card to get you ready for all this summer’s biggest events. As for Refinery29 – don’t know them? Get to know them – we guarantee they’ll be the best bookmark you’ll ever save. Think current affairs made easy, beauty must-haves and all the celebrity news you actually care about. We’ll be revealing more details on how to take part on Monday 6th June so watch this space…

WHAT WE’RE LOVING THIS WEEK

 

  • Off Shoulder Blouson Top shop now
  • Tie Front Shirt Dress shop now
  • Full Cotton Midi Skirt shop now
  • Cotton Cami Midi Dress shop now

LISTEN TO THIS

We don’t know about you but right now we’re firmly setting our sights on summer in the music stakes, lovingly crafting our playlists in anticipation of all the events that require soundtrack this season. Well honestly, there’s nothing worse than a quiet barbeque. Going straight to the top of said playlist is Leeds five piece Modern Pleasure, serving up a slice of luscious sun-drenched indie-rock that we guarantee you won’t be able to get enough of. With their new single White Heels out now, catch them at Leeds Brudenell Social Club on 8th June as they curate an evening of local acts ahead of joining Mumford & Sons at London’s British Summer Time this July. Trust us, you won’t regret it.
Listen now on soundcloud

WE’RE WATCHING…

Tear jerker alert – enter Me Before You, the story of a small town girl that forms an unlikely bond with a recently-paralyzed man she’s taking care of. When Lou Clark, played by Games of Thrones wonder woman Emilia Clarke, loses her humble but beloved job in the Buttered Bun Tea Shop, she takes a whole new direction with her life. When offered a role to care for a recently paralysed man, her life – and his – is set to change forever. Bringing colour and meaning to his life again, this is a textbook love story that means those hankies definitely need to be at the ready.
In cinemas now

posts.title: 5 DRESSES YOU CAN’T BE WITHOUT THIS SUMMER
posts.content:
5 DRESSES YOU CAN’T BE WITHOUT THIS SUMMER

Dresses are the very embodiment of summer. From proms and picnics to brunch and bars, there’s no better time than summer to embrace something a little more fun, free and unashamedly feminine. From the new 90’s shape to the enduring appeal of lace, these are the 5 key dress styles you simply cannot be without this summer.

The 90s Cami Dress

A core piece for this season’s nineties rival, the cami dress is the most versatile styling prop for summer. Layer over classic stripe tees by day, going alone with bright shades and midi lengths by night.

  • Strappy Cami Dress shop now
  • Breton Stripe Tee shop now
  • Denim Jacket shop now
  • Tie Up Flat Mule Shoe shop now

The New Shirt Dress

Give a trusted classic a contemporary update with sleeveless cuts and button details that sing of sunny days. Consider this your how-to when it comes to your summer workwear.

  • Midi Shirt Dress shop now
  • Magnetic Slouch Work Bag shop now
  • Wrap Around Platform Sandal shop now
  • Extreme Round Sunglasses shop now

The Eternal Lace Dress

It’s no secret that a lace dress is a coveted occasionwear classic but it has just as much appeal in everyday life. Go to boho lengths with sheer fabric and maxi lengths, styling with oversized accessories for urban cool. Image: @Joujouvilleroy

  • Huarache Sandal shop now
  • Lace Tiered Dress shop now
  • Lace Embroidered Maxi Dress shop now
  • Catmaster Sunglasses shop now

The Modern Shift Dress

Whether it’s a statement print or a minimalist block colour, the clean cut and throw-on feel of a shift dress is unparalleled when it comes to summer dressing.

  • Bow Detail Halterneck Dress shop now
  • Huarache Sandal shop now
  • Podium Stud Hobo Bag shop now
  • Horn Hoop Earrings shop now

The Anytime Column Dress

From loose jersey to fitted pencil styles, the column dress has certainly made its mark for SS16. For the ultimate holiday vibe, think bold florals and side splits.

  • Palm Print Jungle Midi shop now
  • Ankle Strap Toe Post Sandal shop now
  • Premium Leather Slouch Clutch shop now

posts.title: 7 Style Tips We’ve Learnt From The Boss
posts.content:
7 Style Tips We’ve Learnt From The Boss

There’s a reason they call Bruce Springsteen “The Boss”. A notoriously energetic performer with a career spanning near 50 years, Springsteen is not only a music legend but was – and still is – an icon for the world’s working classes and the definer of all-American style. As you can see, he’s worthy of his moniker. Since the early ’70s, Bruce has been entertaining us from the Jersey shore as we’ve watched in awe, and sartorial admiration, as he grew from scruffy unknown to fully fledged rock deity. As Bruce takes The River Tour 2016 to UK shores this week, we take a look at lessons we can all learn from the Boss.

Oversized Accessories Are Key

When it comes to summer accessories, the bigger the better. Whilst a bakerboy hat may not be your go-to addition, opt for sun worshipping panama hats, long chain necklaces and statement oversized clutches.

Normcore Is Classic

From 26 through to 66, from this first album cover to this latest tour, Bruce Springsteen has championed every day core pieces as the foundations of his distinctive style. Well-made crew neck t-shirts, block colour basics and signature denim form the basis of any respective capsule wardrobe.

We Have The Right To Bare Arms

Sleeveless, cut away, off-the-shoulder – it’s a case of sun’s out, arms out when it comes to summer style. Bruce does it best.

Make It Your Own

As a known voice for the working class, too elements of this can seen in his everyan style with worn denim and work shirts elevated to rock ‘n’ roll status. The key to this elevation? Making the classics your own. Think asymetric knotting, rolled sleeves and styling outside the box to bring traditional designs into the now.

There’s More To Denim Than Jeans

Bruce Springsteen and denim are one of this world’s most powerful pairings, but that’s not to say we should rely only on our jeans. Think outside the sewing box with acid wash denim jackets, anytime dresses and shirts for a more versatile approach.

Twinning Is Trending

Whilst the street style masses may have only recently cottoned on to the trend, Bruce was at it long before. Taking twinning to the next level, Bruce is seen here in matching-glory with none other than Bob Dylan.

Leather Is Always, Always, Always Cool

What else is there to say? Bruce shows us that a leather jacket is always the right choice. One of your wardrobe’s most versatile styling props, use a biker to add a touch of rock prowess to SS16’s notoriously feminine prints.

metadata.value: As Bruce Springsteen takes The River Tour 2016 to UK shores this week, we take a look at style lessons we can all learn from the Boss.
As Bruce Springsteen takes The River Tour 2016 to UK shores this week, we take a look at style lessons we can all learn from the Boss.

posts.title: How To Wear: The New Nautical
posts.content:
How To Wear: The New Nautical

Whilst they say that florals for spring are hardly ground-breaking, the same could be said for tried and trusted stripes – but it rarely ever is. A perennial favourite, this everyman print and its subsequent maritime charm takes hold time and time again without ever feeling tired or overdone. Why, you may ask? The ability to reinvent. For SS16 we make way for a new wave of nautical, reworking stripes for the season with modern detail and feminine flourishes. We show you how.

City By Sea

Work seaside vibes into your 9-5, pairing a loose swan tee with sharp tailoring. Navy culottes tick the box for summer-ready office wear whilst styling with a casual knot adds a dose of urban cool.

  • Swan Printed Blouse shop now
  • Split Side Wide Leg Culotte shop now
  • Backless Slip On Shoe shop now
  • Tort Catmaster Sunglasses shop now

Frill Seeker

An oversized stripe shift takes on a more feminine feel courtesy of fluted sleeves. Pair with statement flats and take this all-rounder piece everywhere, from days in the sun to the latest summer evening pop-up.

Lessons In Layering

When post-office drinks beckon, know this layered shift and shirt combination will keep working long after you do. Swan print proves a worthy alternative to classic stripes whilst maintaining that essential sea flair.

  • Embroidered Swan Shift Dress shop now
  • Silk Blouse shop now
  • Catmaster Sunglasses shop now
  • Large Hoop Shopper shop now

Modern Classic

Every respecting wardrobe knows that a stripe tee is a fundamental styling prop, whatever the occasion. Rethink stripes and bring nautical into the now with a contemporary box fit and contrasting frill sleeves.

  • Panel Stripe Tee shop now
  • Soft Culotte shop now
  • Western Mule Boot shop now
  • Podium Stud Hobo Bag shop now

posts.title: Native Spirit
posts.content:
Native Spirit

Rich colours and intricate embroidery, all paired back with bright white and blue wash denim; festival season is the ideal platform for the free spirited nature of folkflore. From the early doors of Coachella to the final hurrah of Bestival, the enduring appeal of folk styling lies in the sartorial dichotomy of relaxed silhouettes with stiff denim and intricate details. So whether it’s an urban city affair or an all-out field day, here are 5 simple ways to wear this summer’s most essential festival style.

Home & Away

Make your wardrobe work harder this summer with this holiday ‘it’ dress that is as at home on the beach as it is on the field.

Urban Prairie

Folk meets the city as straight cut denim and a box fit toughen up this folk favourite’s feminine appeal.

  • Metallic Gladiator Sandal shop now
  • Off Shoulder Blouson Top shop now
  • Embroidered Midi Skirt shop now
  • Tort D Frame Sunglasses shop now

Modern Bohemia

Give traditional folk pieces a contemporary flair with metallic accessories.

  • Suede Buckle Slouchy Bag shop now
  • Curved Tusk Pendant Necklace shop now
  • Ankle Strap Toe Post Sandal shop now
  • Leather Half Moon Bag shop now

All Day Denim

Forget the jeans – transfer this working man’s fabric to an anywhere-anytime dress, rounding off with authentic accessories in the ultimate festival shade, tan.

70’s Redux

Holding this defining era as inspiration, take this throwback trend into the now pairing this embroidered blouson with denim cut-offs and minimalist accessories.

posts.title: 6 LAZY SUMMER WORKWEAR IDEAS FROM INSTAGRAM
posts.content:
6 LAZY SUMMER WORKWEAR IDEAS FROM INSTAGRAM

What with the stuffy commute, the overly zealous office air-con and the consistent need for an outfit that will last you until the last tube, dressing for the office come summer time is no mean feat. Luckily, Instagram’s fashion elite can show you how with these easy-to-wear summer updates to your 9-5 style.

@wearetwinset

Sarah and Philipa know that the never-fail combination of a neutral trench and cropped jeans is so on point for SS16 that neither would agree to get changed. The slipper flats keep this on the right side of smart for the 9-5.

@harrietstewart

Elle’s resident Market Editor demonstrates the all-important way to style florals for those who don’t necessarily “do” florals. Think bold floral shirts or a statement jacket, paired with tailored trousers, to bring the outdoors in.

  • Floral Bird Print Blouse shop now

@fashionardenter

Suits in this day and age? We think not. Give a nod to traditional tailoring through a crisp blazer, bringing into the now with summer shades of pink and sports touches.

@belleandbunty

Taking twinning to the next level, Alice and Hannah show the power of a humble stripe. Effortlessly smart and classic office print, double up and change direction to give an off-duty appeal.

@thefashionbugblog

@angharadbjones

You heard it here first – the culottes is your new office saviour come summer. Structured and smart with just enough length to air the ankles at lunch, keep it cool with slouch tees.

posts.title: Work It: The Floral Designer
posts.content:
Work It: The Floral Designer

We caught up with Suzie Winsor, graphic designer turned East London florist and illustrator, to hear all about her new floral direction.

Come summer, there isn’t a city park in sight that isn’t saturated with bodies soaking up the sun and getting back to nature. In London alone, the demand for agricultural space is at an all-time high with city dwellers searching far and wide for a coveted allotment space or even a humble balcony to plant a herb garden. Admit it – as a nation, we’re getting seriously green fingered.

With over 10 years’ experience in the creative industry, Suzie Winsor is breaking free from the 9-5 and taking full advantage of said green fingers. A self-confessed Charles Darwin enthusiast and lover of the great outdoors, Suzie is the founder of The Good Natured, a Hackney based business specialising in all things floral from bespoke bouquets to botanical print. With commissions for the V&A as well as illustrating for Belle & Sebastian, we caught up with Suzie at her studio to see what’s next on the agenda…

As a Graphic Designer, what made you want to change direction and explore floristry?

I’ve been inspired by nature for as long as I remember. It started with a portrait I did of Charles Darwin, then slowly I noticed every photo I’d taken and sketch I had done was either a plant or a floral pattern. It sounds like quite a change in career direction but they’re both very creative. I’ve been doing digital design for over 10 years and still love it but I really wanted to get out of my seat and create something with my hands.

What’s the ethos behind The Good Natured?

Living in London is brilliant but can be exhausting at times – being amongst nature is so grounding and calming when you’re commuting daily and working long hours. The Good Natured encourages appreciation of nature in fast paced city life.

Floristry is gaining speed in London. What sets The Good Natured apart?

I combine design and illustration as well as the floristry side of things. I’ve been commissioned to do a lot of wedding stationary alongside the floral arrangements. I’ve also produced personalised wedding illustrations for friends after their big day as something to keep when the flowers have wilted!

Get Suzie’s Look

  • Off Shoulder Top shop now
  • Stripe Midi Pencil Dress shop now
  • Suede Pinafore Dress shop now
  • Sleeveless Stripe Shirt shop now

Who have you been most inspired by?

My parents! They are both keen gardeners and are so inspiring and knowledgeable. My dad used to show me flash cards of flowers when I was little to teach me the names of what was in the garden – keen or what? My mum is a retired fine art teacher encouraging creativity from a very young age and is very inspiring to me. I’m also a big Monty Don (and Nigel) fan – but who isn’t?

…And how do you find inspiration for your prints?

Being outside and often from remembering to look up! I look out for patterns, unusual shadows and reflections in nature on a daily basis. I also carry round the title of one of my favourite books in my head and it’s almost become a motto: “You Can Find Inspiration in Everything – (And If You Can’t, Look Again)” – by Paul Smith.

Describe your signature style…

Clothes wise – navy, denim and stripes take up the majority of my wardrobe. My drying rack looks like Where’s Wally’s most days. I love a pinafore dress but if I’m out in the garden or doing lots of messy jobs I’ll swap them for a good old pair of slouchy dungarees.

What goes in to making your typical bouquet?

The flowers I use will either come from the garden or the flower market. I’ve just started growing my own, which I’m really excited about.

You’ve achieved so much already, what are your career aspirations?

The dream would be to have my own land with a section that’s like the “Secret Garden” where I can grow my own flowers to use in all my arrangements. That or live in Monet’s house perhaps…

What’s next for you?

Lots of weddings! I’m really excited about them all. I have collaborative work and some exciting photoshoots in the pipeline as well. Oh and lots more illustration. I don’t want to give too much away, but exciting times are a coming! Watch this space.

metadata.value: We caught up with Suzie Winsor, graphic designer turned East London florist and illustrator, to hear all about her new floral direction.
We caught up with Suzie Winsor, graphic designer turned East London florist and illustrator, to hear all about her new floral direction.

posts.title: Destination Anywhere
posts.content:
Destination Anywhere

Headed for departures? Whether basking on the sunshine shores of Havana, taking in the culture of Tulum or people watching on the Italian coast, it’s important to pack light and pack right when it comes to your holiday wardrobe. Moving from morning into evening with a key beach-side look thrown in for good measure, we show you how to ace your holiday style, whatever your destination.

HAVANA

Fashion’s most elite – think editors, buyers and influencers – have been treated to some seriously exotic trips in recent seasons to take in luxury labels’ resort shows. Most recently on the fashion map? Havana, Cuba – all courtesy of Chanel’s latest offering. When it comes to being sartorially savvy, embrace the cultural richness of Cuba with print and colour to match the vibrant city walls and life.

TO THE BEACH

Abstract palm prints are an apt reflection of Havana’s lively landscape. Just add accessories.

  • Premium Floral Bikini Top shop now
  • Premium Floral Bikini Bottom shop now
  • Mixbraid Floppy Hat shop now
  • Embossed Croc Shopper shop now

ALL DAY

Shocks of vibrant yellow make a cami and denim combination your go-to uniform for day time explorations.

TO THE BEACH

Woven tribal prints and intense colour reign supreme when it comes to beach-side life. Cover up with oversized accessories in the midday sun before stripping things back for a dip in the cenotes.

PORTOFINO

Famous for its picturesque harbour, pastel-front houses and high-end boutiques, this Italian fishing village is the ideal location to embrace the finery of yacht life and all things riviera. Infused with an on-trend nautical flair, classic silhouettes and clean lines form the core of your Portofino capsule.

posts.title: #Instalunch : Aqua Nueva
posts.content:
#Instalunch : Aqua Nueva

Armed with just our phones and our appetites, we picked the perfect spring day to sample what this newly renovated Spanish restaurant and Regent Street favourite had to offer.

Following last year’s renovation, relaunch and all-round reimagining, we’ll admit that Aqua Nueva was immediately impressive. Having been greeted by an imposing blue bull statue bursting through the wall, we were overwhelmed with decadent furnishings, dim lighting and colossal curved architecture that proved we were a long way from your usual tapas haunt. Add to that the panoramic views and you’ve truly got yourself one of the most modern luxury spaces on Regent Street.

What We Ate

Following the introduction of their Head Chef Yahir Gonzalez, his native influence is immediately apparent giving classic Spanish flavours a Mexicana flourish – think crispy pork skin with chilli lime salsa and spiced aubergine and courgette pisto on soft tacos. Giving traditional Spanish fare an upscale facelift, black seafood croquettes were delicate and crunchy with a smooth interior, the perfect receptacle for an intense aioli. Presentation is clearly of the upmost importance at Aqua Nueva, with even the most unattractive of ingredients being jazzed up to aesthetic perfection – razor clams were effortlessly decorated with upstanding sprigs of samphire and flashes of orange glaze whilst the true star of the show, the seared red tuna, was marinated in black and white garlic before being embellished with edible floral details that sang of spring. Whilst the contemporary dishes were lively with experimentation, it seems that there was a slight miss on the fundamental classics. Patatas Bravas, a favourite carb indulgence, lacked the naughtiness of a garlic mayonnaise leaving it little more than potato wedges and tomato dip. However, when it came to dessert, the board came to life with edible springs, precise cubes of candied melon and delicious coulis making a light and sweet finish to the meal.

What We Drank

As per the guidance of our charming waiter, the cocktails came high on alcoholic content and intrigue. “High Society” packed a punch with Tanqueray gin, Campari and sweet vermouth all offset with the sweetness of peach liqueur and sharpness of pink grapefruit. Think of it as a fruitier interpretation of your traditional Negroni Next up, “Wrap It Up” – a blend of Hennessy Fine de cognac, fig liqueur and mescal cut through with citrus tones and bitters – an initial eyewaterer that subsided to something mellow and moreish.

What We Wore

  • Button Back Cami shop now
  • Wide Leg Culotte shop now
  • Tie Up Flat Mule Shoe shop now
  • Leather Half Moon Bag shop now

What’s The Cost?

When it comes to a venue as extravagant as this, expect to pay a bit of a premium for the atmosphere and views alone. Classic small plates ranged from 6-50 to 9.50 whilst the contemporary dishes came in at 7 – 13.50 due to the more unusual components.

What’s The Verdict?

If you’re looking for traditional Spanish, we’ll stop you now – this isn’t it. However if you’re looking for a movealong that boasts quality ingredients and innovative combinations, then step right this way. Aqua Nueva may not be your usual lunch time jaunt but it’s well worth a visit if you’re feeling a little fancy. Not much of a tapas fan? Enjoy a cocktail in the rooftop space, the views are unrivalled and you certainly get your monies worth.

metadata.value: Armed with just our phones and our appetites, we picked the perfect spring day to sample what this newly renovated Spanish restaurant and Regent Street favourite had to offer.

posts.title: New This Week
posts.content:
NEW THIS WEEK

What’s hot and happening this week – May 20th to May 26th

TRENDING NOW: FANCY FLATS

Heels have been making the news of late, with a waitress having to force her bloodied feet into uncomfortable sky-scrapers and a receptionist being dismissed upon arrival for her footwear failure to meet the required uniform 3-4 inches. Yes, even in this day and age, there is still an aesthetic expectation of women in the work place that starts from the feet up. When Susan Sarandon stepped out on the Cannes red carpet this week in a pair of chic black pumps, she was not only bucking the trend but defying the norm. We say: embrace the flat! Comfortable and stylish in equal measure, make the fancy flat your 2016 go-to.

LOVE YOURSELF

Extortionate rent hikes and the associated crippling debts, the pressures of careers or the lack thereof, the vicious cycle of dating – there is seemingly no end to the stresses that plague so many of us day in day out. Whilst many turn to the usual fodder of self-help books, there’s a new kind of guide to life that is seriously peaking interest. Instead of claiming to fix the problems, The Inner Fix guides us to stay grateful for what we do have, stay strong in the face of hardship and build a truly happy, purposeful life in uncertain times. Well worth a read.
Buy On Amazon now

CAFÉ CULTURE

The latest from the renowned Soho House team, Café Monico promises to take you back to France’s “beautiful age” with their belle époque interior and equally as pleasing menu. This new ‘grand café’ has been styled to reflect a time when art, culture and society as a whole was flourishing so expect the buzz of jazz, decadent wood panelling and the most pristine of bar staff. Whjen it comes to their edible offering, things are just as precise with classic French fayre done well. Think juicy garlic prawns and steak tartare entrees before progressing onto deliciously large portions of confit chicken and moules frites. We hear the afters are something special too – make a date with dessert asap.
Open now, Café Monico, 39-45 Shaftesbury Avenue, London

WHAT WE’RE LOVING THIS WEEK

 

 

  • Tie Up Flat Mule Shoe shop now
  • Metallic Gladiator Sandal shop now
  • Wrap Around Platform Sandal shop now
  • Tie Up Flat Mule Shoe shop now

WE’RE WATCHING

Arguably one of the only franchises not to lose its momentum over the years – well, except for X-Men Origins: Wolverine – it’s hard to believe that the just released X-Men: Apocalypse will be the ninth and potentially last installment. Since the dawn of civilization, Apocalypse, the first and most powerful mutant from the Marvel universe was worshiped as a god, having amassed the powers of many other mutants to become immortal and invincible. Upon awakening after thousands of years, he is disillusioned with the world as he finds it and recruits a team of powerful mutants, including a disheartened Magneto, to cleanse mankind and create a new world order. Enter Professor Xavier, Raven and the other young X-men as they seek to stop their greatest nemesis and save mankind from complete destruction. You know it’s going to be epic.
In cinemas 18th May

ULTIMATE STRESS BUSTER

Had one of those weeks? It happens – but now when the city throws all it has at you, you can throw it right back. Launching this week in East London’s Whitechapel, Whistle Punks aim is to, well; take aim with urban axe throwing. Quite simply, they set up an array of targets, hand you a selection of axes and let you get on with it. Following a brief how-to, you can go wild just yourself or go head to head with another team to score points, making it a particularly good option for your next work away day. Whilst mediation has its plus points, sometimes you’ve just got to throw things.
Open 19th May

posts.title: R.S.V.P. Essential
posts.content:
R.S.V.P. Essential

Wedding next weekend? How about a best friend’s birthday or the first official barbeque of summer with a dress code? These are the events for which every city woman must be prepared come event season. Requiring a standout look that won’t upstage the host but pays homage to their efforts, our occasion edit has everything to need to tick the all-important best dressed box.

New Romantic

Straying from the traditional monochrome palette, tones of red bring dynamism to whimsical lace. Combined with a modern high-neck cut and trend-led midi length, this could well be the dress of the summer.

Tailor Made

Providing a fresh outlook on event dressing, allow yourself to drift beyond the realms of the dress in favour of modern tailoring. For those longing for the unmistakeably feminine feel of occasion style, look to a jumpsuit that blends delicate lace with sharp pleats.

Fine Lines

Sharp, bold and high impact, there’s a lot to be said for the humble stripe. Giving a clean and grown-up free to the classic prom shape, keep accessories sleek and oversized for fail-sale occasion look that’ll last from day at the races to night in the city.

Divide + Conquer

It cannot be stressed enough – there’s more to event dressing than the dress, despite what the term may have you think. Opt for the ease and effortlessness of a two-part ensemble, keeping a static element of print and swapping out block coloured tops for the ultimate in versatility.

Fresh Cut

A new take on traditional lace, for SS16 we explore contemporary cutwork detail and a fresh interpretation of the feminine silhouette. Scalloped necklines and hems work in perfect unison with layered details and strong colour – in short, this is as cool as lace comes.

Modern Minimal

Too many dates to mention? Break free from the confines of occasionwear and opt for an anytime dress suited to the girl-on-the-go. For any and every event the summer has to hold, a minimal block colour midi is the way to go with a flourish of accessories.

shop occasionwear

metadata.value: With summer’s biggest events fast approaching, here’s everything you need to achieve best dressed status.

posts.title: DENIM BY DECADE
posts.content:
DENIM BY DECADE

So just how did this humble essential transform itself from workman’s overalls to ultimate fashion icon?

THE STRAIGHT JEAN

When Marilyn Monroe took denim to the silver screen in 1952 in “Clash By Night”, it set the tone for a new sartorial movement – one where women, including someone who arguably epitomised femininity at the time – didn’t have to live out their days in dresses. Straight leg jeans, as championed by the likes of Presley and Dean, were the piece to covet regardless of gender.

THE WHITEWASH

Swapping traditional true blue washes for a lighter side of the fabric, white denim was an obvious choice for those shrugging off the weight of 50s and settling into a carefree attitude to life and style. A little lighter, a little brighter; Jean Shrimpton’s romantic Riviera styling defined the era.

THE FLARED JEAN

Bell bottoms, wide legs and ultimately the iconic flare, these classic 70s cuts represented fashion’s new found free spirit. By now, things were just a little less straight and narrow and the haute hippy designs as worn by Jane Birkin reflect that.

THE HOTPANT

From 70s uniform to 80s cult classic, by now denim had found an elevated status. Brooke Shields became denim’s new poster girl with her frayed hot pants, as donned in her now infamous Pepsi commercial, creating waves in the industry and imitations of the street. Look to the cinema and you’d see Dirty Dancing’s Baby dancing hers over the bridge.

THE DENIM JACKET

Perennial favourite and symbol of 90s nostalgia, there’s nothing quite like a washed out denim jacket to relive our youth. Completing the nonchalant grunge epitomised by Drew Barrymore and later moving onto the backs of many a Britpop crew, the denim jacket is still as relevant as it ever was.

THE SKINNY JEAN

Now, we could write off the early 2000s by evoking the timeless image of Britney and Justin at the VMAs but that would only seek to undermine the true stand out star of the decade, the skinny jean. Single handedly brought to the masses by Kate Moss, we can hardly remember a time before them.

NOW: THE DENIM DRESS

With boyfriend jeans reimagined for a new age, the denim jacket seeking solace in our trans seasonal wardrobes and shorts forever finding their place in holiday hand luggage, now is the time for something a little different. Step forward, the denim dress. From prairie frills and bardots to clean-cut tees and shirt styles, it’s the styling prop to write home about in years to come.

shop denim

metadata.value: So just how did this humble essential transform itself from workman's overalls to ultimate fashion icon? We take a look at the key denim pieces that defined the eras.

posts.title: NEW THIS WEEK
posts.content:
NEWS

What’s hot and happening this week – May 13th to 19th

WHITER SHADE OF PALE

It’s no secret that come summer, white is without fail the colour to know. What can we say? There’s something about the sun’s rays that draws us to white’s fresh, minimal appeal and cooling qualities. For SS16, spring’s tailored tops and crisp cottons will slowly move into flowing fabrics and occasion lace, switching urban minimalism for sheer romance. Opt for buy now, wear now and later pieces such as prairie drop hem skirts, essential white denim jeans and wrap shirts to tick all the boxes.

LIFE IS A CABARET

Victoria House in London is known for its fashion credentials, seasonally hosting none other than London Collections: Men as well as an array of womenswear events come Fashion Week. But now, alongside this, it becomes the host to a different event entirely – and when we say event, we really mean it. Fresh from its sell out pop up success, The London Cabaret Club now holds permanent residence in the Bloomsbury Ballroom, filling the weekends with an impressive array of flamboyant costumes, live music and some seriously powerhouse vocals. When we popped down to the launch, we were treated to The Best Of British Pop, spanning 60s through to the 00s (Sinitta proving a particular highlight) , with a spot of British Tapas and signature cocktails along the way. It’s not your usual Friday night out, but maybe it should be.
The London Cabaret Club, The Bloomsbury Ballroom, London, WC1B 4DA

WE’RE WATCHING

With the tagline “Here for a good time, not a long time”, it’s safe to say that Everybody Wants Some!! is a stark departure from Richard Linklater’s critically acclaimed Boyhood – ironically filmed over what was a very long time indeed. For his latest offering, Linklater takes an acutely funny and perceptive look at a team of 80s college baseball players as they navigate their ways through the freedom that comes with an unsupervised weekend together. Nostalgic, witty and the picture perfect representation of a teen’s American dream, this is one not to be missed.
Everybody Wants Some!! in cinemas from 13th May

WHAT WE’RE LOVING THIS WEEK

 

 

  • Off Shoulder Top shop now
  • Slip Side Wide Leg Culottes shop now
  • Tiered Midi Skirt shop now
  • Cotton Poplin Ruffle Tee shop now

SKINCARE 1,2,3

Let us set the scene – it’s 7.30am, you’re fresh from 8 hours of pure beauty sleep and you look into the mirror only to see that, frankly, said beauty sleep hasn’t been as successful as you’d quite hoped. Sound familiar? Us too. Whether it’s a little too much fun in the sun, the result of one too many rooftop drinks or a gruelling work schedule, there’s so many factors that can leave your skin looking less than its best. Thankfully Clarins has just the tonic – Boosters. Available in Detox, Energy and Repair, these mini miracles are developed to target specific temporary concerns. Simply add 3-5 drops to your usual skincare, sit back and let the compliments roll in.
£30 each, available from Clarins

IT’S A KIND OF MAGIC

Sometimes art exhibitions get a stuffy rep – there, we said it. However, every now and then on will come along that has such a great story behind it, that you just have to listen up. Mik Artistik’s Magic People is one such exhibition. Having spent the past 30 years drawing people’s portraits onto brown paper bags, speaking to strangers and offering glimpses into their lives – it’s finally time to the canvas to good use. Keeping a similar theme but now focusing on the people of Leeds that have inspired him at gigs, events, parties, Mik is taking the opportunity not previously bestowed to him to meet them properly and place them in his art. “I call them ‘Magic People’ because they made me smile, they had a charge, they intrigued me and made my world a bit more colourful.” Just what art should be.
Magic People is at Besbrode Pianos Leeds until 6th June

metadata.value: What’s hot and happening this week - May 13th to 19th

posts.title: New This Week
posts.content:
New This Week

What’s hot and happening this week – May 27th to June 2nd

TRENDING NOW: RUST

Whilst orange tints and tangerine brights scream out summer, there’s another colour that’s placing itself firmly in the now – rust. Taking on a more burnt feel with undertones of brown, this is the colour to know, particularly when it comes to this season’s occasionwear offering. After all, everyone can wear red but rust will set you apart. We’re obsessed with the shade on traditional lace, offen reserved for a simple monochrome palette, whilst the colour translates just as well to bold accessories and staples.

WE’RE WATCHING…

If you’re partial to a bit of Spandau Ballet (who isn’t?), excessively large hair and a thick Irish accent, look no further for your weekend’s entertainment than Sing Street, an upbeat comedy guaranteed to change your mind on musicals. Set in Dublin in 1985, Sing Street focuses on Conor Lalor, a 15-year-old student from a rough school, who decides to pull together a band from a bunch of his misfit classmates with the sole intention of impressing a girl. However, gone are the Glee style cringe fests that can give musicals a cheesy rep – this is all about witty one liners and an incredible 80s playlist that’ll have you singing long after the credits have started rolling.
In cinemas now

MAYFAIR GETS FLORAL

In honour of Chelsea’s annual horticultural event, London’s Mayfair has been getting its own piece of the action with an all-out floral takeover at Sketch. Showcasing five garden installations, all unique in style but unified in their celebration of the British landscape, each Mayfair Flower Show exhibitor also explores their personal relationship with the venue. With bold blooms dripping from the ceiling of the entrance to a botanic hinterland taking over the iconic Pod loos, the results are truly breathtaking. Add to that a floral themed afternoon tea and bespoke botanical cocktails from Champagne Pommery, you’re a long way from those dreary childhood afternoons spent dragging your heels in garden centres. But be quick – the takeover ends this Sunday.
Until 29th May

WHAT WE’RE LOVING THIS WEEK

 

 

  • Lace Tiered Dress shop now
  • 90's Split Side Vest shop now
  • 90's Column Skirt shop now
  • Suede Buckle Heeled Shoe shop now

CHEERS TO THAT

It’s no secret that as a nation our obsession with all things gluten free, fat free, raw, vegan, green and all-round good for the body and soul is growing fast. Baileys , also known as everyone’s Yuletide guilty pleasure, is aware of this and has tapped into the trend, taking the notoriously cosy drink and making it available for vegans (and anyone else who can’t deal with dairy) to enjoy. New Baileys Almande is made from a blend of sweet almond oil, almond essence, cane sugar, purified water, and vanilla. That means its gluten free too! Now, we’re not saying it’s a health food but…
Available now

WE ARE FESTIVAL

Looking for something a little different this Bank Holiday? Trade picnics in the park for raving in the dark (and all day too, of course), courtesy of award-winning dance music event We Are Festival. If variety is the spice of life, it’s looking extremely hot with a staggering 14 stages boasting a host of acts including Fatboy Slim, Craig David’s TS5 and techno legend Sven Vath. What truly sets this event apart is the production – get lost in exciting concepts such as Island Hideaway, the Ancient Realease and Disco Tropics. We cannot wait –
We Are Festival, Upminster, 28th – 29th May

posts.title: The SS16 Accessories Report
posts.content:
The SS16 Accessories Report

The shoes, the bags, the headwear – keeping up with this season’s fresh-from-the-runway accessories obsession is no mean feat. From can’t-live-without shoe shapes to the finishing touches that can make or break your holiday wardrobe, breakdown the core trends for SS16 with these definitive accessories set to take you from spring into summer in style.

The Festival Sandal

Look beyond the field and style it out at some of the city’s finest festival offerings in these tan zip sandals, ideal from holiday to home.

The Press Favourite

Editors far and wide have given their sartorial seal of approval for this summer’s coveted half-moon bag.

The Quick Fix

The single most important possession in your summer bag, go nowhere without a pair of anywhere-anytime shades. We choose tortoiseshell thanks to its seriously versatile appeal.

The Supersize

One of the key trends to take away from this season’s runways had to be the penchant for all things oversized. Make use of this easy-to-wear style from brunch in the east end to the beaches of the west coast.

The Urban Kick

Replacing the classic black Chelsea, a tranquil shade and modern mule cut make these western mules the only boots to be seen in this summer.

The Evening Mini

A neutral shade and minimalist box shape make this shoulder bag a lighter option come night fall.

The Beach Saviour

Nothing beats the romance and glamour of an oversized headpiece come summer, harking back to the timeless Riviera styling of Hepburn and Bardot.

The Slipper Refresh

Our best-selling slipper has been reinvented for the changing season, lightened up with trend-led animal print and a delicate lace tie. It’s the perfect choice with ripped denim.

The Leather Go-To

The need to keep it hands-free is paramount – with so much to do and see, cover the essentials with quality leather and timeless designs. This navy cross-shoulder clutch is the one.

The Go-Between

It’s no secret that, regardless of the season, the weather is prone to a mishap or two. Tackle any last minute chills head on with a printed scarf – tassel detail optional but highly recommended for a chic beach vibe.

SHOP ACCESSORIES

metadata.value: Get ready to accessorise all areas with our edit of the 10 pieces you can’t be without this spring.

posts.title: A Return To Romance
posts.content:
A Return To Romance

Hanging on the petticoats of the 19th century, for SS16 we take influence from the Victorian era of wealth and exploration. A time of discovery and travel, from the antiquities of Africa to the artefacts of Cairo, our aesthetics are dominated by decadent colour, global prints and the air of romance that defined the era.

A Modern Interpretation

Bringing this print into the now, style our toile du jouy shirt with blue wash denim and modern block heels.

In The Detail

Delicate embroidery adds a hint of romance to loose styles, embracing the Victoriana in all its glory.

  • Toile De Joie Wrap Dress shop now

The Vintage Design

Embody spring’s whimsical mood with relaxed silhouettes and traditional lace.

The Key Colour

Intense rust brings a real sense of finery and decadence, bringing an element of the unknown to traditional lace fabrics.

Toile de Jouy Print

Taking inspiration from the discovery of a new world, our in-house animal print fuses the tropical with the traditional.

posts.title: 5 TOPS YOU NEED FOR AN INSTANT SPRING REFRESH
posts.content:
5 TOPS YOU NEED FOR AN INSTANT SPRING REFRESH

Signature denim, your favourite skirt, those office-essential culottes – all these wardrobe staples need to come into the now is a hint of new season freshness. The simplest way to do it? It’s all about the top, the hero piece to wrapping up all spring’s most coveted trends into one single package.
From tweaked tees to essential camis, these are the key styles set to define SS16.

The 90s Essential

Understated stripes, button detail and a nonchalant feel go into making this cami the most coveted 90s staple. Keep the trend running with wide leg cropped jeans for an instant throwback feel.

The Babydoll

Weekend plans call for easy-chic with hero pieces that work as hard as you do. With wide straps and a feminine air, the new wide strap cami is an around-the-clock essential with trusted skinny jeans.

The New Neckline

The Bardot cut is simple yet seductive, covering the bust yet revealing the shoulders for a sensual edge. Dress down with cropped denim and oversized accessories for a 90s interpretation, looking to plisse midis and lace for a new age take on prairie.

The Frill Seeker

Indulge your fanciful side for SS16, adding a touch of artful flamboyance to classic designs with flounces, frills and ruffles. Your t-shirt will thank you.

The Print Wonder

At once evoking the rolling hills of the prairie and the south coast of the French Riviera, gingham is one of the most impactful prints for spring. The urban feel of this printed blouse makes it one of the season’s true game changers.

metadata.value: The easiest wardrobe updates for spring? It’s all about your top game.

posts.title: The Evolution Of The Prom Queen
posts.content:
The Evolution Of The Prom Queen

Esteemed mathematician? An artist excelling in your field? Please, in this very rare instance, step aside for if teen movies have taught us one (rather bad) lesson, you are no one at high school if you’re not the Prom Queen. Over the years, the big screen has been dedicated to countless tales of homecoming glory and picture perfect prom nights with the title Prom Queen heralded as the highest accolade in the American educational system. However, the way we perceive these teen dreams has somewhat changed over the year evolving constantly from seventies sweethearts through to nineties nightmares. Here’s how.

The Classic Queen

Grease, 1978
The delightful Sandra Dee was everything a Prom Queen technically should be – the perfect balance of popular and polite; courteous and charming; intelligent if a little twee. Dancing her way into everyone’s good-books, there was a lot to be learnt from Sandra Dee’s ways. Well, until she swapped her signature look for bad-girl leather and smoking.

The Iconic Queen

Pretty In Pink, 1986
Molly Ringwald’s prom dress is iconic and the perfect summary of flamboyant 80s fashion as a whole. Andie has to make the tough teen dating decision between her doting best friend and a rich but sensitive playboy – we’ve all been there, of course. Blaine, said playboy, is lead astray by bad friends but Andie has the ultimate feminist laugh, attending prom to “show they didn’t break me”. We bow down.

The Undercover Queen

Never Been Kissed, 1999
Journalist Josie Geller (Drew Barrymore) was known as Josie Grossie in her school days, if that tells you anything. Returning years later as an undercover student to get a story for her boss, the only way to get the story is to get popular. Having been ridiculed and stood up for prom in the past, Josie not only gets the inside scoop from the most popular girls but ends up winning Prom Queen. An excellent result.

The Criminal Queen

Jawbreaker, 1999

A dark comedy classic, Rose McGowan starred as the only Queen on this list to kill someone. Vibrant cinematography contrasted the murderous story whereby McGowan’s character Courtney and friends played a prank on the most popular girl in school; unintentionally killing her with a jawbreaker they have shoved in her mouth to keep her from screaming. Courtney decides to say nothing and relishes in the fact that she is the new most popular girl in school and the new Prom Queen. It’s definitively an unexpected turn in the Prom Queen history.

The Uncrowned Queens

10 Things I Hate About You, 1999

1999 was a big year for prom films, fact. Whilst much attention is given to the Queens themselves, we spare a thought for the good girls beaten to the post by the archetypal high school bully and the ones who may not have been nominated but were the stars of the show. Whilst the zero to hero trope (removing nerdy glasses to reveal unparalleled beauty to those in the know ) may not sit well in 2016, it did in ’99 and made She’s All That one of the most memorable high school films ever. Elsewhere, the modern take on Shakespeare’s Taming of the Shrew, 10 Things I Hate About You, showed the Anti-Prom Kat get her happy ending. It may be worth noting, she was very much right about prom.

The Unconventional Queen

Mean Girls, 2004
New girl Cady Heron, as played by Lindsay Lohan, initially hangs out with the aforementioned mean girls to research them and find their faults until she too transforms into a mean girl. She wins prom queen despite Queen Bee Regina George’s best efforts but it’s all a little too late. However, at her core, Cady never changed and, after realizing her evil ways, destroys the coveted crown to make all in attendance the Queens of their prom. Order well and truly restored.

  • Lace Tiered Dress shop now
  • Floral Print Prom Dress shop now
  • Cross Back Dress shop now
  • Micro Pleat Midi Dress shop now

metadata.value: With prom season fast approaching, we take a look at what makes a Queen.

posts.title: The New Skirt Shape
posts.content:
The New Skirt Shape

Cut to the knee with a feminine A-line flair, say hello to the Midi skirt – your anywhere, anytime essential for the season ahead. On-trend and seriously versatile, the midi skirt has fast shed its previously conservative image to become a modern sartorial classic. It’s a look that fits to spring’s every-changing outlook – flashing just a hint of skin to accommodate our optimism whilst remaining practical and on point. It is elegant in a subversive way, lending itself effortlessly around the clock from morning coffee to late night cocktails.
Still need convincing? We show you how.

R.S.V.P.

Soft pleats and a crisp white shade make this midi the go-to piece for SS16. Needing little more than a delicate cami, allow this subtle combination to take preference over the dress for a contemporary take on event dressing.

To The Races

It’s not always about the dress, don’t you know. For a fresh take on the annual sporting events, look to a bold printed midi with block colour basics for a failsafe races-ready wardrobe.

Spring Awakening

Taking note of the fresh tones that define the season, soft powder blue suede epitomises spring in all its glory. Paired with a 90s wide strap camisole, there’s a minimal sophistication to this midi that cements it as one of your wardrobe’s most versatile pieces.

Off-Duty Appeal

There’s a lot to be said for keeping it simple. Pair a high neck sleeveless blouse with a contrasting anywhere-anytime midi and say hello to your new season wardrobe. This ready-in-5 look is a weekend essential.

Own The 9-5

In need of a smart yet feminine working wardrobe? Ace the 9-5 dress code in modern tailored pieces with a relaxed edge. Forget the suit – the linen midi skirt takes care of the office dress code thanks to its crisp A-line silhouette and soft spring finish. Go tonal with premium basics – think cupro vests in complimenting tones.

SHOP ALL SKIRTS

metadata.value: Hint – it’s all about the midi.
